alt: Stunning auroras are set to be visible in several US states starting Friday through Sunday, with experts predicting the best views will be seen on Saturday
article_heading: Historic solar flare heading to Earth will trigger stunning auroras across the northern US - here's where to see the phenomenon
description: The image captures a breathtaking scene of the Aurora Borealis, also known as the Northern Lights, dancing across the night sky. The aurora, a natural light display, is a spectacle of nature's beauty, characterized by its mesmerizing patterns and vibrant colors. In this image, the aurora is a stunning blend of green and purple hues, with hints of blue and pink, creating a mesmerizing visual effect.  The aurora is set against a backdrop of a starry sky, with the Milky Way galaxy faintly visible, adding to the sense of vastness and wonder. The scene is framed by a forest of tall, slender trees, their silhouettes standing out against the luminous sky. The trees are scattered across the foreground, their dark forms providing a stark contrast to the luminous aurora.  The image is taken from a low angle, which enhances the grandeur of the scene and makes the aurora appear even more dramatic. The perspective also allows for a clear view of the aurora's movement and the starry sky, creating a sense of depth and scale.  Overall, the image is a stunning representation of the natural world's beauty and the awe-inspiring spectacle of the Aurora Borealis.

alt: Graph showing the number of people in English and Welsh regions giving up Christianity from 2011 to 2021 rise in people following no religion
article_heading: Britain is entering its first 'atheist age': Non-believers now outnumber those who believe in God - as parents fail to pass their religious beliefs on to their children, study finds
description: The image is a bar chart titled "Regions in England and Wales giving up Christianity for No Religion (2011 to 2021)." The chart is divided into two main categories: "Christianity" and "No religion." Each category is further divided into regions across England and Wales.  The bars are color-coded, with the "Christianity" category represented in red and the "No religion" category in blue. The bars are labeled with the names of the regions, such as "North," "East," "West," "Humber," "Midlands," "East of England," "London," "South," "South West," and "Wales."  The chart shows a significant increase in the percentage of people who have given up Christianity for no religion across all regions. The highest percentage increase is in the "London" region, which has seen a 1,000,000% increase in the number of people who have given up Christianity for no religion. The "South West" region has seen a 500,000% increase, while the "East" and "Midlands" regions have seen a 200,000% increase. The "North," "Humber," and "Wales" regions have seen a 100,000% increase. description: The image is a bar chart titled "FOLLOWERS OF THE MAJOR RELIGIONS IN ENGLAND & WALES." The chart is divided into two columns, each representing a different year: 2011 and 2021. The bars are color-coded to represent different religious groups.  In the 2011 column, the tallest bar is labeled "Christian," indicating that Christianity had the most followers in England and Wales at that time. The bar is colored in red. The second tallest bar is labeled "No religion," suggesting that individuals who do not follow any religion were the second most prevalent group. This bar is colored in blue. The third bar is labeled "Muslim," and it is significantly shorter than the first two, indicating that Muslims were the third most followed religion in England and Wales in 2011.  The 2021 column shows a similar pattern, with the "Christian" bar still being the tallest, now in a different color, indicating a change in the color coding between the two years. The "No religion" bar is also tall, but slightly shorter than the "Christian" bar, and the "Muslim" bar is still the third tallest, but the height has increased compared to 2011.  At the bottom of the chart, there are icons representing the different religions: a cross for Christianity, a crescent and star for Islam, a peace sign for Hinduism, a lotus for Buddhism, and a Star of David for Judaism. article_heading: Update your iPhone NOW: Apple releases an urgent security update that fixes a 'rare' bug - here's how to install it on your device
description: The image appears to be a screenshot of an iOS 18.0.1 update notification on an iPhone. The notification is displayed in a pop-up format with a blue background and white text. The update is described as providing important bug fixes and security updates for the iPhone, including the iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro models. It mentions that the touch screen may be temporarily unresponsive in certain circumstances on these models. The update also includes a feature that allows the camera to freeze when recording macro mode video on the Ultra Wide camera in 4K with HDR turned off on iPhone 16 Pro models. Additionally, messages may unexpectedly quit when replying to a message with a shared Apple Watch face. The update is available now and can be installed at night.

article_heading: Update your iPhone NOW: Apple releases an urgent security update that fixes a 'rare' bug - here's how to install it on your device
